intro: Memecylon danguyanum, commonly known as the Danguyanum memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
